artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Keikaen Keika; Publisher: Akiyama Buemon; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
dimension: 14 1/2 × 9 3/4 in. (36.83 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
inscription: 花の香も/露けきものよ／旅び衣 {Hana no ka mo / tsuyukeki mono yo / tabigoromo}
life_date: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi, Japanese, 1839–1892; Keikaen Keika, Author, Japanese; Akiyama Buemon, Publisher; Wada Yūjirō, Carver, Japanese, 1857–1905
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 彫勇 {hori Yū} | Seal below his name reads 人間萬事 {Ningen banji}.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
text: Ichikawa Danjūrō IX as Benkei in the play Kanjinchō. Poem by Keikaen Keika.
title: Ichikawa Danjūrō IX
